title: Core Teaching-Based Learning Program for Elementary Science Teachers' Professional Development

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational educational theory and basic understanding of elementary science curricula
context.additional_context: A program focused on enhancing science teaching competencies applicable to real classroom settings for pre-service elementary teachers. Conducted in a blended format combining online theoretical learning and offline practical sessions.

learning_goals: Learners apply the Instructional Core Framework (content, pedagogy, student outcomes) to design an elementary science lesson plan, meeting ≥4 of 5 peer/instructor evaluation criteria (e.g., content relevance, pedagogical diversity, measurable outcomes).

Learners observe ≥3 real science classes (middle/high school) over two weeks, select one for analysis of five effective teaching strategies (e.g., inquiry-based learning, cooperative learning), then create a 15-minute mock lesson scenario applying the selected strategy.
Developing three or more interactive class activities to enhance learners' scientific thinking skills.
Cultivating the ability to establish lesson improvement plans through collaborative feedback with peer teachers.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
